## Discussion

This method is automatically invoked in response to an [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextStorage/edited(_:range:changeInLength:)] message or an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableAttributedString/endEditing()] message if edits were made within the scope of a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableAttributedString/beginEditing()] block. You should never need to invoke it directly.

This method begins by posting an [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextStorage/willProcessEditingNotification] to the default notification center (which results in the delegate receiving a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextStorageDelegate/textStorage(_:willProcessEditing:range:changeInLength:)] message). Then it fixes attributes. After this, it posts an [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextStorage/didProcessEditingNotification] to the default notification center (which results in the delegate receiving a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextStorageDelegate/textStorage(_:didProcessEditing:range:changeInLength:)] message). Finally, it sends a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutManager/textStorage(_:edited:range:changeInLength:invalidatedRange:)] message to each of the receiver’s layout managers using the argument values provided.

# processEditing()

**Instance Method**

Cleans up changes to the text storage object and notifies its delegate and layout managers of changes.

## Declaration

```swift
func processEditing()
```

## Discussion

This method is automatically invoked in response to an [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextStorage/edited(_:range:changeInLength:)] message or an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableAttributedString/endEditing()] message if edits were made within the scope of a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableAttributedString/beginEditing()] block. You should never need to invoke it directly.

This method begins by posting an [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextStorage/willProcessEditingNotification] to the default notification center (which results in the delegate receiving a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextStorageDelegate/textStorage(_:willProcessEditing:range:changeInLength:)] message). Then it fixes attributes. After this, it posts an [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextStorage/didProcessEditingNotification] to the default notification center (which results in the delegate receiving a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/NSTextStorageDelegate/textStorage(_:didProcessEditing:range:changeInLength:)] message). Finally, it sends a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutManager/textStorage(_:edited:range:changeInLength:invalidatedRange:)] message to each of the receiver’s layout managers using the argument values provided.

## Managing edits

- **edited(_:range:changeInLength:)**: Tracks changes made to the text storage object, allowing the text storage to record the full extent of changes.
